alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 8:52PM MDT until April 04 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT TUESDAY FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM UNTIL 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Critical fire weather conditions will persist through the overnight and through Tuesday across much of central and eastern New Mexico. Winds will finally taper off Tuesday night with a hard freeze and somewhat higher humidity to alleviate critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT TUESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and East Central Plains (Zone 126) until 2 AM MDT Tuesday and again from 10 AM MDT to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph until 2 AM MDT Tuesday. West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph after 10 AM MDT Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values 4 to 10 percent Monday evening and Tuesday. Several hours of single digit relative humidity values are likely Tuesday with poor humidity recovery early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
